article_text: The Kansas House had a chance last week to show it represents the people, as it finally held committee hearings on whether to newly insure 150,000 Kansans and bring badly needed dollars to Kansas hospitals by expanding KanCare, the state’s privatized Medicaid system. But the compelling testimony at the packed hearings was as far as it went.

article_metadata.title: KanCare expansion is critical | The Wichita Eagle

But the compelling testimony at the packed hearings was as far as it went.
The Kansas House had a chance last week to show it represents the people, as it finally held committee hearings on whether to newly insure 150,000 Kansans and bring badly needed dollars to Kansas hospitals by expanding KanCare, the state’s privatized Medicaid system.
